|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 74K |cpu1_type_rev = R2 |cpu1spd = 300 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = Serial |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Winbond;25X32VSIG; |flash1size = 4 |flash1maxsize = 3801088 |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 32 |ram1chip = Winbond;W9425G6EH-5H; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Broadcom;BCM53115;BCM53115SKFBG; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 1GbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = IEEE 802.3/3u/3ab |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 00:25:9C |oui = 00:25:9C |bootwait = |stockbootloader = CFE |stockos = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = 4.5 |pwr_barrel_inner = 2 |pwr_barrel_len = 10 |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, internal,, 5-pad header,, unpopulated,, 3.3V TTL,, (115200 8N1) |jtag = yes |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = linksys |default_ch = |manuf = CyberTAN |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT,TomatoUSB |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = 04/10/2009 |reldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = |buttons = |led = |dimensions = 8.0" x 6.3" x 1.3" |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = Internal |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = 17 |rad1cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "3762-02010206R" is silkscreened on the board. The power adapter included with the device is a '''Linksys''' AD12V/1A-SW. ID/OD/Len measurements are approximate. Exactly the same hardware as [[Cisco Valet Plus M20|Cisco M20]] ==Links of Interest== *[http://dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=57459&highlight=wrt310n On the DD-WRT forums] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== {{DDWRTNotice|k26req}} Supported by dd-wrt as of = dd-wrt.v24-13594_NEWD-2_K2.6 # Do a [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/Hard reset or 30/30/30|30-30-30]]. Router goes into management mode. # Select the option to reset the NVRAM. # Select the option to reboot the router. # Log into default Linksys router web control panel. # Use normal Linksys firmware upgrade process to load this image
[ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/BrainSlayer-V24-preSP2/2010/08-12-10-r14929/broadcom_K26/dd-wrt.v24-14929_NEWD-2_K2.6_mini_wrt310nv2.bin dd-wrt.v24-14929_NEWD-2_K2.6_mini_wrt310nv2.bin] # Do another [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/Hard reset or 30/30/30|30-30-30]] after the upgrade. Router goes into management mode. # Select the option to reboot the router. # Start using DD-WRT ===Flashing Tomato=== Please insert instructions here ==Upgrading== {{Upgrade dd-wrt}} ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===JTAG=== ====JTAG Pinouts==== nTRST 1o o2 GND TDI 3o o4 GND TDO 5o o6 GND TMS 7o o8 GND TCK 9o o10 GND nSRST 11o o12 N/C ==Pictures==
'''User Images''' File:Linksys_WRT310N_v2_board_top.jpg|board top
[[Has images::internal| ]]
'''TTL Serial Connection''' You'll need a 3.3v capable TTL level converter like CP2102 chipset device. (find at amazon, ebay, etc) The unpopulated pads are labeled J14. Pinout is: 3.3v, TX, RX, NC?, GND. Serial settings 115200,8,N,1. File:wrt310n_v2_TTL-serial_overview.jpg|Overview File:wrt310n_v2_TTL-serial_pinout.jpg|Pinout File:USB-TTL-232-485-converter.jpg|USB Converter (notice TX->RX and RX->TX)
